de.awi.floenavigation.grid

Class Zoomer

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.awi.floenavigation.grid.Zoomer

  • public class Zoomer
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple class that animates double-touch zoom gestures. Functionally similar to a Scroller.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int mAnimationDurationMillis
      The total animation duration for a zoom.
      private float mCurrentZoom
      The current zoom value; computed by computeZoom().
      private float mEndZoom
      The destination zoom factor.
      private boolean mFinished
      Whether or not the current zoom has finished.
      private android.view.animation.Interpolator mInterpolator
      The interpolator, used for making zooms animate 'naturally.'
      private long mStartRTC
      The time the zoom started, computed using SystemClock.elapsedRealtime().

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Zoomer(android.content.Context context) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void abortAnimation()
      Aborts the animation, setting the current zoom value to the ending value.
      boolean computeZoom()
      Computes the current zoom level, returning true if the zoom is still active and false if the zoom has finished.
      void forceFinished(boolean finished)
      Forces the zoom finished state to the given value.
      float getCurrZoom()
      Returns the current zoom level.
      void startZoom(float endZoom)
      Starts a zoom from 1.0 to (1.0 + endZoom).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • mInterpolator

        private android.view.animation.Interpolator mInterpolator
        The interpolator, used for making zooms animate 'naturally.'

        private int mAnimationDurationMillis
        The total animation duration for a zoom.

        Whether or not the current zoom has finished.

        The current zoom value; computed by computeZoom().

    • Constructor Detail

      • Zoomer

        public Zoomer(android.content.Context context)

    • Method Detail

      • forceFinished

        public void forceFinished(boolean finished)
        Forces the zoom finished state to the given value. Unlike abortAnimation(), the current zoom value isn't set to the ending value.
        See Also:
        Scroller.forceFinished(boolean)

      • abortAnimation

        public void abortAnimation()
        Aborts the animation, setting the current zoom value to the ending value.
        See Also:
        Scroller.abortAnimation()

      • startZoom

        public void startZoom(float endZoom)
        Starts a zoom from 1.0 to (1.0 + endZoom). That is, to zoom from 100% to 125%, endZoom should by 0.25f.
        See Also:
        Scroller.startScroll(int, int, int, int)

      • computeZoom

        public boolean computeZoom()
        Computes the current zoom level, returning true if the zoom is still active and false if the zoom has finished.
        See Also:
        Scroller.computeScrollOffset()

      • getCurrZoom

        public float getCurrZoom()
        Returns the current zoom level.
        See Also:
        Scroller.getCurrX()
